definition: to come first in triennial palace examinations (idiom, refers to the carved stone turtle head in front of the imperial palace, next to which the most successful candidate in the imperial examinations was entitled to stand)/to be the champion/to be the very best in any field
to take possession of/to occupy/to take up
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: We make sure your business stays ahead of the competition and leads the pack.
sentences.chinese: 我们确保你的业务在竞争中脱颖而出，并独占鳌头。

sentences.english: Guesses on which cake is likely to go first ...!
sentences.chinese: 大家猜猜看哪个蛋糕可能会独占鳌头呢？

sentences.english: We might say that our products are the very best on the market.
sentences.chinese: 顺便奉告，我方产品在市场上独占鳌头。

sentences.english: GM led all carmakers with a forty-seven percent increase.
sentences.chinese: 通用以47%的增幅在汽车制造商中独占鳌头。

sentences.english: Hope dominates the international stage as well.
sentences.chinese: 霍普同样在国际舞台上独占鳌头。

definition: lit. late-comer lives above (idiom); the up-and-coming youngster outstrips the older generation/the pupil surpasses the master
a long way in front/to lead by a wide margin
lit. only one branch of the tree is thriving (idiom)/fig. to be in a league of one's own/outstanding
an up-and-coming youngster/new talent/a brilliant younger generation
to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
to emerge as a new force to be reckoned with (idiom)
to take the lead in a race/to set the pace
to rank (number 1, or third last etc)/to be among (those who are in a particular group)
